thread.title: Alaska Airlines Continues to Grow Seattle Hub with New Raleigh/Durham Service
thread.title_full: Alaska Airlines Continues to Grow Seattle Hub with New Raleigh/Durham Service

author: Alaska Airlines (info@www.akbizmag.com)
title: Alaska Airlines Continues to Grow Seattle Hub with New Raleigh/Durham Service
text:
Alaska Airlines Continues to Grow Seattle Hub with New Raleigh/Durham Service New Service from Emerald City Alaska Airlines Published: October 2, 2015 
SEATTLE — Alaska Airlines is expanding its Seattle hub today with the start of new service from the Emerald City to Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina. Raleigh is the sixth new city the carrier has added this year, following last month’s start of service from Seattle to Nashville and New York City’s JFK. 
Summary of new Seattle-Raleigh/Durham service: Start date 9 p.m. Daily 
Introductory one-way fares starting at $169* are available for purchase between Seattle and Raleigh/Durham through Oct. 3. Travel must be completed by Dec. 16. For complete fare rules, including blackout dates and travel restrictions, visit www.alaskaair.com or call 1-800-ALASKAAIR (800-252-7522 or Hearing & Speech Impaired (TTY): Dial 711 for Relay Services). 
Flights will be operated by fuel-efficient Next Generation 737 aircraft. Onboard, customers will get to enjoy more of what they love with free exclusive programming streamed to their own devices, Pacific Northwest-inspired food and beverages and power outlets at each seat.
